Query: Move all files with a certain extension from multiple subdirectories into one directory

so_14345714: Moving files with an extension into a location
su_1556021: How do I move all file with specific extension to a specific directory?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_31035376: for i in A B C D E  
do  
  mv Folder$i/file.txt NewFolder/file_$i.txt  
done

so_14345714: find src/dir/ -name '*.txt' -exec mv -t target/dir/ -- {} +

find src/dir/ -name '*.txt' -exec mv -- {} target/dir/ ';'

find src/dir/ -name '*.txt' -print0 | while IFS= read -rd $'\0' file; do
    mv -- "$file" target/dir/"${file//\//_}"
done

su_1556021: for dir in */; do
    echo mv "$dir"/*.exr "$dir/2048x567"
done

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_484961: Move contents of all sub subdirectories up into just their subdirectories
ul_484754: Move all files into subdirectories named after part of file name
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_484961: for dir in */*; do
  if [[ -d "$dir" ]]; then
    ( 
      cd "$dir"
      mv -n * ..
      cd ..
      rmdir "$( basename "$dir" )"
    )
  fi
done

This command is  used  with --logdir. --logflush Clears (flushes) the log file after each write action. --logdebug Also  output  debug-level  messages  in  the log (equivalent to setting the env var QT_LOGGING_RULES="qt.*=true;*.debug=true"). ) --confdir <dirname> Uses the specified configuration directory. The ownCloud Client reads a configuration file.
